name: I Flew on Hawaiian Airlines' Boeing 717!
description:
Back in May of this year, I found myself in Hawaii on my way home from Japan, and so I, naturally, had to go looking for some special inter-island flights while I was there!

Hawaiian Airlines' inter-island operation with their Boeing 717-200s has always been a topic of interest for me, so I grabbed a quick round-trip between Honolulu and Lihue to check them out for myself!

SOURCES: 
Hawaiian 717 replacements: https://www.flightglobal.com/fleets/hawaiian-to-decide-on-717-replacements-in-coming-months/154729.article

Delta/Qantaslink 717 retirements https://www.qantasnewsroom.com.au/media-releases/qantas-prepares-to-farewell-boeing-717-welcomes-more-new-aircraft/ https://www.indianeagle.com/traveldiary/delta-air-lines-boeing-717-aircraft/

Delta 717s getting upgraded wifi: https://www.ajc.com/news/business/delta-to-retire-boeing-717s-some-767s-by-end-of-2025/46ZUEXXTTNEPDH4IO5U6T2AK5U/

Hawaii and ferries: https://www.hawaiistar.com/why-are-there-no-ferries-between-hawaiian-islands/

BR715 engines: https://www.boeing.com/commercial/aeromagazine/aero_05/textonly/ps03txt.html

Lihue Airport statistics: https://www.transtats.bts.gov/airports.asp?20=E&Nv42146=YVU&Nv42146_anzr=Yvu7r,%20UV:%20Yvu7r%20Nv42146&pn44vr4=SNPgf

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Hawaiian Airlines (HAL/HA)
Aircraft: Boeing 717-200 (B712)
Flight Number: HA133/154
Seat: 24F/22A
Livery: New
Engines: 2x BMW RR BR715
Registration: N484HA/N494HA
Route: Honolulu (HNL) - Lihue (LIH) - Honolulu (HNL)
Callsign: HAWAIIAN 133/154
Runway used: 8R (HNL) - 35 (LIH) - 3 (LIH) - 4R (HNL)
Date filmed: May 2023
